fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50600].
  {panel}

Hi, I thought this will be a better platform to raise this concern instead of Atlassian Answers.

It is possible to subscribe team calendars on Google Calendars with a url e.g
http://<confluence site>/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/export/subcalendar/private/qascdtgbhfff19564cd25efghj68fd2b649kjhg9.ics

I tested this out on a browser without Confluence log in, and it is possible to download the ics file.

This means that it is possible to get confidential calendar information with a brute force dictionary attack. This is especially so when the length of the file is 40 characters.

Is there any way of preventing this? Or Whether we can turn off the subscribe feature without breaking other parts?
fields.summary: Potential security risk for Team Calendar subscribe feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50585].
  {panel}

Seems to affect all versions of the JIRA calendar and Team Calendars plugins. 

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project in JIRA (let's call it TEST), and add 3 versions to that project (example: v1, v2, v3)
# Add a Version Release Date to each version
# Create 3 issues under the project, each linked to 1 unique fixVersion (example: Issue1's fixVersion=v1, Issue2's fixVersion=v2, Issue3's fixVersion=v3) 
# Create a JIRA Calendar in Team Calendars (in Confluence), with the following JQL:
{code}
project = TEST AND fixVersion = v1
{code}
Make sure that the *Version Due Date* checkbox is ticked.

Notice that the Version Release Date is shown for all 3 versions, when we are only interested in one. 

Actually, I'm not too sure whether this is an expected behavior or a bug, since the fixVersion field is mostly used only to filter issues, not specifically to filter version release dates.
fields.summary: JQL filter does not work for Version Due Date (if you wish to filter based on versions)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50575].
  {panel}

We upgraded the JIRA Team Calendar to v1.9.1 to receive the Search Filter capabilities, but after upgrade, I attempted to add a new JIRA Calendar.  Then form to setup the calendar starts out showing the 2 radio buttons (1: Project; 2: Search Filter), it then disappears and is no longer available.  We are only able to add a Project filter and nothing else.

Please help.

Thank you
Dean Berman
dberman@scires.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50574].
  {panel}

As far as I can tell, there are two ways to view a calendar in Confluence: 
# Add it to my "calendars" view. 
# Render it in a confluence page using the \{calendar\} macro. 

This latter approach only allows me to render a single calendar in a page. I'd like the ability to render more than one calendar in a wiki page. The old calendar plugin provided this, and it was a nice feature. It allows an easy way to show several related calendars in a single view without the need to have every single person replicate that view on their own.
fields.summary: Add ability to render multiple calendars in a single calendar macro in-page
The "no calendars found, want to create or find one" link is broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50571].
  {panel}

On adding a new events to a people calendar and entering a user's name in the "Who" row only resolves users from the Internal Confluence directory. Users from the configured active directory can only be found when entering the userid, e.g.

+Active Directory+
Userid: tkrug0210
User Name: Thomas Krug
Entering "Thomas" or "Krug" returns no result. Entering "tkrug0210" shows my account. 

+Internal Directory+
Userid: admin
User Name: Confluence administrator
The user is found with any string "confluence", "conf", "admin", "administrator" etc.
fields.summary: Users from Active Directory are not resolved by name on adding events
Description of event in e-mail  is displayed with html escape character (for Russian language)

h3.Workaround
Upgrade to JIRA 5.0 or higher, which is compatible with JIRA Calendar Plugin version 1.19, which do not have this issue.

*OR*

Downgrade the Team Calendars plugin in Confluence to version 2.3.2 (Uninstall the 2.4.0 plugin from {{Confluence Admin >> Plugins >> Team Calendars}}, before installing version 2.3.2 of the plugin obtained here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/version/1302)
fields.summary: Project validation error when creating a JIRA Calendar
Cyrillic characters are displayed incorrectly in personal calendar events

Spun off from TEAMCAL-502.:

Open Team Calendars on node 1 and then on node 2 with the same user => Error 
This error persists until I clean the cache ("Calendar Plugin - Popular sub-calendar subscription statistics").

I'm not sure when this was introduced (might have always existed). Seems to be caused by the wrong type of object in the popular subscriptions cache.

fields.summary: Clustering cache bug
If you have multiple UALd servers and one of them doesn't have the latest jira-ical feed, then TEAMCAL-417 feature doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50538].
  {panel}

Hi,

One of our customer wants to embed the "Upcoming Events" on a Confluence page and wants to hide it from dashboard.
Can we have a feature to 'hide a calendar' ?

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Possibility to hide a calendar from dashboard
ics import issue
Rename "effect" to "affect" in the select start day of the week setting, add a fullstop at the end of the sentence
Scroll bar does not look right on the list of fields in the subscribe to Jira calendar dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50526].
  {panel}

#Scenario 1
- Delete application link
- JIRA is still running

Result: 500 Error not encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence. 

#Scenario 2
- Delete application link
- Emptying the cache

Result: 500 Error IS encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence. 

#Scenario 3
- Re-create application link
- JIRA is shut down

Result: 500 Error not encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 4
- Delete application link
- JIRA is shut down

Result: 500 Error IS encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 5
- Startup JIRA
- Application link not created

Result: 500 Error IS encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 6
- Startup JIRA
- Application link is re-created

Result: NO 500 Error in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 7
- JIRA is running
- Application link exist
- Delete a project in JIRA that is associated with a calendar in Confluence

Result: NO 500 Error in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 8
- JIRA is running
- Application link exist
- jira-ical-feed plugin is disabled

Result: Team Calendars complains of a connection problem - "You may want to check the connection to XXX".

Conclusion: 500 errors will occur if the application link is deleted.
fields.summary: Gracefully fail if application link is deleted
More button is cut off on dashboard
Event details icon not scaled back in the event details popup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50521].
  {panel}

embedding a teamcal macro in a wiki page

the macro is defined to display multiple calendars and also to display in list view

as you can see from the attached series of screenshots, the events are not presented in date order

(screenshots 1-3 were produced by scrolling the window rendered by the teamcal macro)
fields.summary: list view containing multiple calendars does not display events in date order
When Jira is prompting a user to set a time zone in one tab, Team Calendars will not allow one to create new calendars
Assignee and Status incorrect in JIRA event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50514].
  {panel}

The team calendars works fine within the personnel space, but when embedded within another page we get the following error:

Error rendering macro 'calendar' : com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: The calendar id can only contain letters or numbers

I have tried turning both the following on:
* Relaxed parsing mode
* Relaxed validation mode

but neither have made any difference.

We are currently running an evaluation copy (installed today 07-11-11), and would like a fix (with enough time to conduct a full evaluation) before the license runs out.

Please find attached a copy of the support request file.
fields.summary: Calendar returns macro error when displaying calendars within a page.
License page should not redirect to UPM (if UPM 2.0 is installed)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50502].
  {panel}

The default 200 events per calendar can be rather limiting, for some of our enterprise customers. 

The workaround posted [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/%27Some+events+were+not+shown+in+the+calendars+below+because+there+were+too+many+of+them%27+error+in+Team+Calendar] to add the {{-Dcom.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.display.events.calendar.maxpercalendar=500}} startup parameter to get around this limitation works, but the calendar performance is hit dramatically especially when we have more than 400 events per calendar.

Is there any way we can improve the performance of the Team Calendars in such situations?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Performance issue with too many events per calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50501].
  {panel}

Hi team!

I am receiving a error when I try to import a file generated in Outlook 2007.

I attached two .ics files where CorrectExportedFile.ics is used to export a calendar from Confluence to Outlook. This works properly. But a error is raised when I try to export (WrongContentFileToImport.ics) from Outlook to Confluence calendar.

Any idea what is happening?

I have other question: exists any documentation about how to integrate Team Calendars and Outlook? Is it possible? I mean if is possible the sincronization between Team calendar and Outlook.

Thanks in advance.
Kind regards,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50496].
  {panel}

Related issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22283

[Display URL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+an+Application+Link] is configured when configuring Application Link in the Confluence admin panel. This URL is used when displaying JIRA links in Confluence in the browser.

But Team Calendars links to JIRA issues using the Application URL and not the Display URL.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project on JIRA, with an issue that has a due date
# Set up an Application Link between Confluence and JIRA by navigating to {{Confluence Admin >> Application Links}}, make sure the Display URL is different than the Application URL.
# Add a JIRA calendar to Team Calendars using this guide: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Adding+a+JIRA+Calendar
# Make sure that you are able to see the issue you created in Step 1 in your Team Calendars.
# Hover over the issue, right click and copy link address. Notice that the link is based on the Application URL and not the Display URL in step 2.
fields.summary: Links to JIRA Issues are created based on Application-URL and not on Display-URL
Clicking "add event" from the feature discovery dialog does not contextually select the right calendar in the event calendar dialog
Selecting subscribe to calendar no longer has the calendar URL selected
Please clarify/identify the frequency that Outlook uses to refresh team calendar data
Don't receive notifications when either a new event is created or an existing event is edited - Also doesn't display as an update in dashboard
Upcoming events email does not show events for today
Error with team calendar created for JIRA project that has a plus sign in the project name
Unable to change JIRA calendar color
error occurs in calender pages
in the search dialog, the bottom of long characters get cut off
Calendars subscribed from Google calendar doesn't update automatically after 1 hour in Team calendar

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50460].
  {panel}

Hi, 

We (RefinedWiki) have a customer which have noticed a problem when changing page size by hiding the left column of the RefinedWiki Original Theme.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/85918/team-calendars-and-refined-wiki-creates-some-distortion?page=1#87644

It looks like all event items in the calendar have a fixed width which is recalculated when you change the width of the browser window. But when you are hiding the left column the recalculation doesn't take place. 

Do you guys have any input on how to solve this issue? I guess you have bind an event which detects when the browser window is changed and then fire the recalculation event. 

Thanks for the help

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50453].
  {panel}

There is probably nothing that can be done about this on the Team Calendars side, but I am logging this as an FYI for any customers using Team Calendars on Confluence Standalone on OD a la carte.

If the user adds a profile pic using <username> -> profile then this profile picture will not propagate to Team Calendars (or Confluence even).

If the user wants this profile picture to appear on Team Calendars then they will have to change their profile picture via Browse -> User Settings -> Profile TAB -> Picture

Related JIRA Studio / OnDemand issues:
* https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5120
* https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5693
fields.summary: Studio Profile pics do not appear on Team Calendars in Studio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50452].
  {panel}

The message shown to users when their Team Calendars plugin has expired could benefit from some re-wording to better communicate the On Demand model.

The current messages are:
* *Admins:* Calendar in read-only mode. Please update Team Calendars Plugin's license [here|http://my.atlassian.com].
* *Non-admins:* Calendar in read-only mode. Please ask your administrator to update the Team Calendars Plugin license.

Specifically, we'd like to avoid  the word "license", since the license is effectively an implementation detail in On Demand (the customer never sees it).
Instead we'd like to go with the following:
* *Admins:* This calendar is read-only. To work with calendars, please [renew your Team Calendars subscription|http://my.atlassian.com].
* *Non-admins:* This calendar is read-only. Please ask your administrator to renew your Team Calendars subscription.
fields.summary: Message when license has expired in On Demand does not reflect the On Demand subscription model.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50446].
  {panel}

Hi, 

I've installed Team Calendars 1.1.0 via UPM in Confluence 3.5.5. When I paste the license (evaluation) in the configuration form and click update button, it redirects to a "page not found exception" showing the following message: 

"The requested URL /confluence/admin/calendar/updatelicense.action was not found on this server."

Having a look at the error I've seen that the error page redirects to 
"http://localhost/confluence/admin/calendar/updatelicense.action"

Confluence is not installed in my localhost, so the correct URL should be "http://<my_server>...". I've tried to change "localhost" with my server's name in the URL, but no success.

Steps to reproduce:

2. Pick a server 
3. Start typing some JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50442].
  {panel}

Since Conflunece's default #header positon is relative,

(can check from /download/superbatch/css/batch.css )

'Team Calendars' plugin has #header { position: static; } css in it.

It changes offsetParent of <div class="aui-dd-parent quick-nav-drop-down" style=""> (which determines Confluence Quick Search Result Box) from div#header to div#full-height-container

which makes it skip <div id="header-precursor">'s height and occurs design problem.

(Other plugin makes DIV inside div#header-precursor and Confluence Search Result Box ignores its height and appear up than usual)



I was about to put

jQuery('#header').attr("style","position:relative !important;"); to revert #header's position into relative,

but I'm aware of design problem might occur with Team Calendars Plugin.

Is it safe to roll back to relative?
fields.summary: Team Calender changes #header position to 'static'

In https Mode is isnt possible to add an Calendar to a Site ( the macro isnt saved )
